alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; McClain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 1:26PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cleveland and south central McClain Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 125 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of Wayne, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southern Norman, Purcell, Noble, Slaughterville, Lexington, Goldsby, and Wayne. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 84 and 102. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Severe weather is not expected and no warnings are anticipated at this time. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
